metro.WindowControls

Interface ControlElement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, Checkbox, Input, InputField, Label, List

    public interface ControlElement
    The interface with all the important methods every control element should have.
    Author:
    hauke

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clickOnControlElement()
      When mouse clicked on control.
      void draw()
      Draws the control.
      java.awt.Point getPosition()
      Returns the current position of this control.
      void keyPressed(int keyCode)
      Fires, when a key has been pressed.
      void keyUp(int keyCode)
      Fires when a key has been released.
      void mouseScrolled(int amount)
      Fires when users scrolls.
      void moveElement(java.awt.Point offset)
      Moves the element.
      void setPosition(java.awt.Point pos)
      Sets a new position
      void setState(boolean enable)
      Sets the enable state of the control.
      void setText(java.lang.String text)
      Updates the text of the control.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw()
        Draws the control.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics handle.

      • clickOnControlElement

        boolean clickOnControlElement()
        When mouse clicked on control.
        Returns:

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(java.awt.Point pos)
        Sets a new position
        Parameters:
        pos - New position as Point.

      • setText

        void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Updates the text of the control.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text.

      • setState

        void setState(boolean enable)
        Sets the enable state of the control. If it's disabled, the user can't interact with this control.
        Parameters:
        enable - The new state of the control.

      • getPosition

        java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns the current position of this control.
        Returns:
        Position as Point.

      • moveElement

        void moveElement(java.awt.Point offset)
        Moves the element.
        Parameters:
        offset - The amount of pixel to move. This is NOT the new position, only an offset!

      • mouseScrolled

        void mouseScrolled(int amount)
        Fires when users scrolls.
        Parameters:
        amount - Positive or negative amount of steps since last frame.

      • keyPressed

        void keyPressed(int keyCode)
        Fires, when a key has been pressed.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The code of the key as int.

      • keyUp

        void keyUp(int keyCode)
        Fires when a key has been released.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The code of the key from Input.Keys
